column5: Hey guys, Me and a few buddies want to go to bay of quinte for some walleye but lots of google searching has turned up nothing for ice bungalows or hut rentals with overnight stays  (weekend). Was just wondering if anyone could recommend a place, does bay of quinte even have ice bungalows. Not looking for anything guided. Thanks in advance

No bungalows that I know of, but sunset cove has decent cabins and hut rentals for a fair price. Ive never stayed there, but they are in a good location, and the ice is good where they are right now too.  They come up on google.  S.
Thanks, looked on Google and the only thing that comes up is sunset farms I saw they had cabins so it might be the same thing. If not could you post me the link please. Thanks
Thats the place. On cty rd 15 in northport.  S.

Lots of hotels around the Bay with some being super cheap and close to the water. Try Twin Peaks in Napanee... I stay there all the time. Cheap and close to Deseronto/Napanee area to fish.  Also, if you're looking to go with a guide, def look up Joe from PB&J charters. http://www.pbandjcharters.com/
Another vote for Joe!! Great guy, true fisherman. It's all about fishing
www.quitehardwaterspecialists.com  they're posting pics regulary on facebook, they have portable huts, you'll probably have to find a place to stay yourself
